hanzi-su-wiki:
給

Значения

После 2-й основы глагола образует фамильярную форму повелительного наклонения, а также обозначает действия 2-го или 3-го лица, характерные для вежливой речи; снабжение, зарплата

Мнемоника

Снабженец ткацкого производства, уважаемый человек, который привозит нитки 糸 и объединяет 合 старые запасы и новый товар.

Варианты

给

给给		give, by, for, let, salary, wage, gift

  • a dress of gathered 合 silk 糸 to give as a gift

heisig_chinese_memo: Spiderman wanted to be a salaryman, but the suit just didn't fit him as perfectly as his Spidey costume so he had to give his suit to a colleague and go back to fighting crime.
heisig_constituent: salary, thread, spiderman, fit, meeting, umbrella, one, mouth
Keyword_KANJIDIC: salary, wage, gift, allow, grant, bestow on
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: заработная плата, заработная плата, подарок, посолить, грант, даровать
koohiiStory1: If your threads 糸 don't fit 合 right you're not going to be able to get a job with a decent salary.
koohiiStory2: Spiderman has so little free time in his schedule that he is unable to fit in a job with a good salary.
jp_example_words:
給仕(きゅうじ): office boy (girl), page, waiter
給食(きゅうしょく): school lunch, providing a meal
給う(たまう): to receive, to grant
配給(はいきゅう): distribution (eg. films rice)
補給(ほきゅう): supply, supplying, replenishment
給与(きゅうよ): allowance, grant, supply
給料(きゅうりょう): salary, wages
供給(きょうきゅう): supply, provisions
月給(げっきゅう): monthly salary
支給(しきゅう): payment, allowance
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Your threads have to suit you if you want a good salary. No one is going to give you a salary if your clothes don't suit you. You have to look professional!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: When you see someone wearing a fancy suit that suits them, don't you wonder about how much their salary is?
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Your salary is paid in cucumbers (きゅう). Maybe you shouldn't have worn that cucumber tie when you interviewed for this job, even though it suited you well.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine your salary being paid in cucumbers. Open that sweet paycheck and watch the cucumbers come tumbling out.
Ru_Meaning: salary, wage, gift, allow, grant, bestow on
Ru_Radicals: 个 (китайский счётный суффикс), 口 (рот), 小 (маленький), 幺 (короткая нить), 糸 (нить)
Ru_trainchinese:
gěi: (глаг) давать, предоставлять; позволять, разрешать; служит для выражения пассива
gěi: (предлог) для (вводит дополнение адресата в дательном падеже); (в предложениях повелительного наклонения ставится перед 我 для дополнительного смыслового акцента)
gěi: (предлог) используется после глагола и вводит дополнение в дательном падеже; служит для выражения пассива
jǐ: (графема) снабжать, обеспечивать; богатый, обильный, достаточный
Kanshudo_mnemonic: if the thread (糸) fits (合) get a supply of it
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Spiderman doesn't fit a businessman salary type of job.  He likes to give more than take.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of "糸" and "合", the original meaning is rich and abundant. "Shuowen": "Xiangzuya. From Shitou, together sound." "Guanzi‧ Guoxu": "Therefore, it is used to store Jia to visit the city, and to take advantage of the people and not give, a hundred times the original." "After ten years of travel, Qin Minda said, "There are no thief in the mountains, no thieves in the mountains, and the family is full of people."

" Give " also means supply and give. "Warring States Policy‧Qin Policy Four": "A country with a few people is poor, I am afraid I can't give it." The eighth poem of Jin Taoqian "Reading the Book of Mountains and Seas": "Chiquan gives me drinks, Yuanqiu has enough food."

" Give " also means connected. "Mandarin ‧ Jin Language One": "The commandment is not like Yu, and then give it." Wei Zhao's Note: "Yu, prepare it. Give it, and give it." "Han Shu·Chao Cuo Zhuan": "Dismount the horse and fight with swords and halberds. Then, if you go, you will be inferior, and the Xiongnu's feet will be able to give." Yan Shigu's note: "Give, it means connected.

" Gei " also means cause in modern and modern Chinese, such as to call, let, and as a preposition, which means to be, to, and to. The former is like the 53rd chapter of "The Scholars": "Master Zou never wins, and he usually loses today." The latter is like "Beat someone", "Give you a gift", "Send a gift to the teacher" .
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of "糸" and "合", the original meaning is rich and abundant.
humanum_full_description:
從「糸」，「合」聲，本義為豐富，充裕。《說文》：「相足也。从糸，合聲。」《管子‧國蓄》：「故使蓄賈游市，乘民之不給，百倍其本。」《史記‧商君列傳》：「行之十年，秦民大說，道不拾遺，山無盜賊，家給人足。」

　　「給」也表示供給、給予。《戰國策‧秦策四》：「寡人之國貧，恐不能給也。」晉陶潛〈讀《山海經》〉詩之八：「赤泉給我飲，員丘足我糧。」

　　「給」亦表示連及。《國語‧晉語一》：「誡莫如豫，豫而後給。」韋昭注：「豫，備也。給，及也。」《漢書‧晁錯傳》：「下馬地鬥，劍戟相接，去就相薄，則匈奴之足弗能給也。」 顏師古注：「給，謂相連及。」

　　「給」在近、現代漢語中還表示致使義，如叫、讓，以及作介詞，表示被、為、向。前者如《儒林外史》第53回：「鄒師父是從來不給人贏的，今日一般也輸了。」後者如「給人打了」、「給你送禮物」、「給老師行禮」。
humanum_short_description: 從「糸」，「合」聲，本義為豐富，充裕。

  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 糹 [ sī ] silk; thread
    • 合 [ hé ] to combine, to join, to unite; to gather
①交付，送與：給以。給予。送給。獻給。
②把動作或態度加到對方：給他一頓批評。
③替，爲：給大家幫忙。
④被，表示遭受：房子給火燒掉了。
⑤把，將：請你隨手給門送上。
給以 [ gěi yǐ ]: to give; to grant
①供應：供給。補給。給養。自給自足。
②富裕，充足：家給人足。
③敏捷：言論給捷。
給予 [ jǐ yǔ ]: to accord; to give; to show (respect)
(Simplified: 给)
Pictophonetic: 合 indicates the sound; 糹 (thread) conveys the meaning.

從「 糸 」，「 合 」聲，本義為豐富，充裕。《說文》：「相足也。从糸，合聲。」《管子‧國蓄》：「故使蓄賈游市，乘民之不給，百倍其本。」《史記‧商君列傳》：「行之十年，秦民大說，道不拾遺，山無盜賊，家給人足。」 「 給 」也表示供給、給予。《戰國策‧秦策四》：「寡人之國貧，恐不能給也。」晉陶潛〈讀《山海經》〉詩之八：「赤泉給我飲，員丘足我糧。」 「 給 」亦表示連及。《國語‧晉語一》：「誡莫如豫，豫而後給。」韋昭注：「豫，備也。給，及也。」《漢書‧晁錯傳》：「下馬地鬥，劍戟相接，去就相薄，則匈奴之足弗能給也。」 顏師古注：「給，謂相連及。」 「 給 」在近、現代漢語中還表示致使義，如叫、讓，以及作介詞，表示被、為、向。前者如《儒林外史》第53回：「鄒師父是從來不給人贏的，今日一般也輸了。」後者如「給人打了」、「給你送禮物」、「給老師行禮」。
From the sound of " 糸" and " 合", the original meaning is rich and abundant. "Shuowen": "Xiangzuya. From Shitou, together sound." "Guanzi‧ Guoxu": "Therefore, it is used to store Jia to visit the city, and to take advantage of the people and not give, a hundred times the original." "After ten years of travel, Qin Minda said, "There are no thief in the mountains, no thieves in the mountains, and the family is full of people." " Give" also means supply and give. "Warring States Policy‧Qin Policy Four": "A country with a few people is poor, I am afraid I can't give it." The eighth poem of Jin Taoqian "Reading the Book of Mountains and Seas": "Chiquan gives me drinks, Yuanqiu has enough food." " Give" also means connected. "Mandarin ‧ Jin Language One": "The commandment is not like Yu, and then give it." Wei Zhao's Note: "Yu, prepare it. Give it, and give it." "Han Shu·Chao Cuo Zhuan": "Dismount the horse and fight with swords and halberds. Then, if you go, you will be inferior, and the Xiongnu's feet will be able to give." Yan Shigu's note: "Give, it means connected. " Gei" also means cause in modern and modern Chinese, such as to call, let, and as a preposition, which means to be, to, and to. The former is like the 53rd chapter of "The Scholars": "Master Zou never wins, and he usually loses today." The latter is like "Beat someone", "Give you a gift", "Send a gift to the teacher" .

給字的基本解释

給
gěi

給
jǐ
均见“给”。

給字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jǐ］
［《廣韻》居立切，入緝，見。］
“给1”的繁体字。
(1)丰足；充裕。
(2)供给；供养。
(3)泛指供应。
(4)敏捷。
(5)连及。
[②]［gěi］
“给2”的繁体字。
(1)使对方得到或遭受到。
(2)被。表示被动。
(3)为；替。引进动作的承受者。
(4)跟；向。引进动作的对象。
(5)让；使；叫。表示容许或致使。
(6)用于动词前，表示加强被动或处置等语气。

給字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【糸字部】　給； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页923第06
【廣韻】【正韻】居立切【集韻】【韻會】訖立切，?音急。【說文】相足也。【玉篇】供也，備也。【左傳·僖十三年】敢不共給。【前漢·禮樂志】日不暇給。【註】給，足也。　又【集韻】極業切，音劫。敏言也。【禮·仲尼燕居】恭而不中禮謂之給。【註】謂㨗給。【論語】禦人以口給。【何晏註】佞人口辭㨗給。　又【集韻】於業切。義同。　又【集韻】轄夾切，音洽。歲在未曰汁給。通作洽。

給字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
給字的起名意思

暂无。

give
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jǐ］
["Guangyun" Ju Liqie, be arrested, see you. ]
Traditional characters for "给1".
(1) Plenty; abundance.
(2) Supply; support.
(3) Refers to supply in general.
(4) Agility.
(5) Connected.
[②]［gěi］
Traditional characters for "给2".
(1) Make the other party get or suffer.
(2) By. Indicates passive.
(3) To; substitute. Introduce the bearer of the action.
(4) Follow; to. Introduce the object of the action.
(5) Let; make; bid. Indicates to allow or cause.
(6) Used before verbs, it means to strengthen the passive or dispositional tone.
give
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Not concentrated] [Shizi Department] 　给; Kangxi strokes: 12; Page number: page 923 06
[Guang Yun] [Zheng Yun] Ju Li cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] Li cut, sound urgent. [Said the text] The same is enough. 【Jade articles】Provide and prepare. [Zuo Zhuan·Xi Thirteen Years] Dare not to give together. [Previous Han·Liyuezhi] I have no time to give it every day. [Note] Give, it's enough.　 [Ji Yun] Extreme karma cut, sound robbery. Min Yan also. 【Rite·Zhongni Yanju】Respectful but not courteous means giving. [Note] That is 㨗 to. [The Analects] The imperial person gave it by mouth. 【He Yan's Note】Ning's remarks are given.　[Jiyun] Yuyeqie again. The same meaning.　[Jiyun] Administer clip cutting, sound harmony. Juice is given at the age of Wei Yue. Through consultation.

Radicals: 糸, 合  (thread, suit)
Meaning Mnemonic
Your threads have to suit you if you want a good salary. No one is going to give you a salary if your clothes don't suit you. You have to look professional!
When you see someone wearing a fancy suit that suits them, don't you wonder about how much their salary is?
Reading Mnemonic
Your salary is paid in cucumbers (きゅう). Maybe you shouldn't have worn that cucumber tie when you interviewed for this job, even though it suited you well.
Imagine your salary being paid in cucumbers. Open that sweet paycheck and watch the cucumbers come tumbling out.
